caption: This is my favorite place for Sichuan in Houston, and maybe my favorite restaurant overall. The prices are extremely reasonable and cheaper than any Sichuan inside the loop, and the food is simply better. The spicy beef noodles are …
This is my favorite place in the area to get Sichuan hot oil wontons!

(Translated by Google) I ordered a lettuce on chowbus, it was all oil, and there were a lot of rotten leaves. I said that I would add another dish next time, and I didn’t want to refund the money. So whoever might order another one would be unlucky!  (Original) 在chowbus上订个油麦菜，都是油，还很多烂叶子，说下次补个菜给我，不愿意退钱，就这样谁可能再定他家，自认倒霉了！
(Translated by Google) Yes, my friends like the boiled fish there  (Original) 不错，朋友很喜欢那里的水煮鱼
I ordered not spicy for kids but they are all spicy! This place is very bad!

(Translated by Google) It’s very unpalatable. I ordered the bullfrog and the fat intestines. It is almost impossible to see which one is the bullfrog and which is the fat intestine. It is full of chili seeds and peppercorns. If compared …
I don't know if the food is good, but good luck getting it. I was told my order would take 30 minutes, which is already longer than usual. It is now 53 minutes and no food. Not acceptable.
Food was every good! Definitely coming back!

Rating is closer to a 4.4 or 4.5 but I rounded up because Sichuan noodles is sooo much better than mala as multiple reviews have stated and for good reason. Smaller place but quality of food was so much better for great prices. Ordered …
Food was amazing. Literally drooling as I ate.
I love this place. I love the food, the service. But we're in the middle of a pandemia. Tpday the restaurant cooks were not using masks.
(Translated by Google) A very delicious restaurant, the price is very cheap, the food tastes great, I have always liked it  (Original) 非常好吃的一个餐馆，价格很便宜，菜的味道很赞，一直很喜欢
Delicious carry out Szechuan food!! Their dishes don't taste heavy and oily like Mala's do. Food has a great pepper tingle without too much spice.
delicious food

(Translated by Google) The taste is completely different from before Now the soup is like soy sauce with water The side dish and the pepper chicken have no taste or taste  (Original) 味道完全跟以前不一樣、以前最愛吃的店 現在湯頭跟醬油加水一樣 小菜跟椒麻雞沒味道也沒椒麻味

The food is tasty, and reasonably priced. Not a big place, but interior deco is still relatively new and fresh. One word of caution, when they say spicy, they mean mouth on fire kind of spicy, which is characteristic of Sichuan cuisine.
A clean place and good service. I had Sichuan special noodle with beef which is not bad, it's something difference from the normal noodle

More like a 3.5, the food was delicious, we got a beef brisket noodle, sichuan fried rice, and spicy beef noodle. There were only a few people in the restaurant when we went. The service though, could have been better, it was difficult to …
Food was okay but kinda of misleading but love the atmosphere 😌

Mala and Chengdu taste cannot beat this place. I have been to almost all of the sichuan food places in Houston and this is my new favorite. The food here is mind blowing. My recommendations: Spicy Crispy Chicken Cumin Lamb Spicy Boiled Fish Filets Twice cooked pork Eggplant in garlic sauce

I’ve tried about three Sichuan restaurants in town and this is by far my favorite so far. Again I’m not a food blogger nor am I earning a free meal to post a good review. Rather an honest review.  Here’s my list of go to foods to try here: …
(Translated by Google) Delicious! Very tasty! Cheap and affordable!  (Original) Delicious! 非常好吃！便宜又实惠！
Friendly restaurant, reasonable price and traditional Sichuan cuisine !
Cheap and good taste!
The service is getting much worse than previously, not sure whether the owner or manager was changed recently.
Wonderful and delicious menu items and vegan friendly too.

I had a bowl of noodles with chili oil and ground pork sausage on top. My mouth went numb and loved the spice. Super simple but made just right. I've been dreaming about that bowl of noodles for a couple weeks now. It came out to 10 dollars with tax and tip.
This tiny, warm restaurant really has nice and polite waiters. The food quality is also very fresh and delicious. I would recommend this place to anyone who loves Chinese food.

This place is excellent. It reminds me of Mala before it got famous and so expensive. The prices at extremely cheap, and the food is amazing. The Sichuan noodles and the Dan Dan noodles are very good, and the Chong quing style chicken ( …

(Translated by Google) Ordered two bowls of noodles, a bowl of dandan noodles: a little spicy, a bowl of sauerkraut pork noodles: no taste. Noodles are semi-finished products made by machines or bought, not the kind of noodles in Sichuan. …

The Sichuan (or Szechuan) food here is legit, one of the best in town. There are quite a few Sichuan restaurants in Houston now but most of them are all hype (looking at you Mala, Chengdu, Pepper Twins). If you're craving some real …
Probably the only clean place to eat at Chinatown
Good taste especially their chicken as well as their beef noodle.
Good food.  Very good service.
This place never disappoints! Definitely a gem that is underrated for some reason. I've been going to this place for many many years now, love it!

(Translated by Google) This is the case when the dish comes up. This is the most unpalatable grilled fish I have ever eaten. The whole fish is fried, the fish are fried, the food is very dry, very dry, and the side dishes are poor, and 30 …
Great food, nice staff. Not a huge fan of there dinning environment, personally
Best Sichuan Food in town!

I was here with friends for dinner. We had clay pot noodles 沙锅麵 and some appetizers like special chicken 怪味鸡, sliced beef in Sichuan sauce 夫妻肺片, dried bean curd with scallions 葱油豆干 and kelp salad 凉拌海带丝.  Food was great but service was …
Ordered the Dan Dan noodles to go, came out pretty quick and tasted awesome!
Great food, with family style warm welcome waitress. Food is pretty authentic Sichuan style. The only complain I have is the place is always crowed. :)
Great food with decent price.
Great food and great taste
Amazing food!
My most favorite restaurant - authentic Sichuan style !

This noodle shop has the BEST noodles. Every time I’m craving comfort food, I think of this noodle store. I particularly love their beef noodles. As an ABC, I am practically always craving Chinese cuisine and this is the closest thing to it!
I loved their fish fillet in cold pot. I need to go back and try other dishes.
Very good Sichuan food!!!! At the rigth price. Crispy Sichuan chicken, Dan Dan Noodles, Eggplant in garlic sauce and the Brisket noodle soup are very good!
(Translated by Google) Is it too salty to eat? It's going to be dialysis!  (Original) 太鹹太鹹了能吃嗎？都要洗腎了！

Decent food and prices. The language barrier is a bit of a challenge for order recommendations. Enjoyed 3 different dish. I was caught off guard by the Sichuan Pepper in my noodle dish, as I imagine inexperienced traditional Chinese …

Fast and good service, although left a bad taste in my mouth. Literally. I ordered the spicy beef noodles and realized it had a funny after taste. I asked my husband to try it to see if it was just me or not. He said there was a slight …
They have the best Chengdu fried rice in Houston. Some other dishes are also good. Price is okay. Some rude waitress chased me out of the door asking for more tips.
Brisket noodles was the best. Dumplings were great. Service was patient and answered questions.

Got the beef brisket noodles, spicy crispy chicken, tofu with ground pork, and dumplings. Everything was amazing. Also was served some kind of cabbage with a pepper sauce on it (not sure the name sorry) and soup as an appetizer for free. …
(Translated by Google) Excellent noodles restaurant. Try those with minced meat and chilli  (Original) Ottimo noodles restaurant. Da provare quelli con carne macinata e peperoncino
Very friendly waitresses and waiters make dining here a pleasant experience. Great food and variety make it even better!
Excellent Chongchig Spicy Chicken ! Good price 10/10 on Chicken
Good authentic food, reasonable prices, family friendly, and quick service. Will be back.
Prices are low and the food is good.  The Szechuan Spicy Tangy Noodle is my favorite dish here - this dish is strangely addicting and sounds just like the name implies.
Nothing special just ok
great food and service
The restaurant served us 2/3dishes with bad , rotten meat. When we complainted, the owner denies and never gave any refund. The noodle was decent.
Amazing noodles and spicy crispy chicken. Underrated sichuan food place that is pretty authentic.
Food has great spicy flavor! They modified 4 of their dishes to make them vegetarian-friendly for my group. Our waitress was attentive when taking our order. Will definitely be back!
Give this place a try. You'll be happy you came. Marvelous food from spicy to mild. Huge menu. Great service and fast. Nice deco.  Would return for sure.
Deliscous food. Will go back again. The Sichuan dumplings were my favorite but look forward to trying everything!

The food was ok , it has authentic flavor which is very good. The reason I gave it two stars because the waitress was extremely rood and to top it off when we were leaving we left her a tip which was not enough for her she pointed at the …

The price is cheap, but food is mediocre. We ordered 4 dishes, all are somewhat greasy, even more than the Sichuan food I had in China! But slightly greasy is not a big deal. The main thing was the flavor. It was not as intense as I expected, which is the reason I like Sichuan cuisine.
Spicy Chinese food is okay but too oily. Don't get the expectation too high. Service is close to nothing.
The food is amazing here, great flavor and the employees are really friendly!!

The best Szechuan restaurant in Chinatown is Mala.  Sichuan Noodles is a good alternative if you are looking for a quick, inexpensive noodle meal.  The Szechuan Spicy Tangy Noodle (dandan noodle) is a large bowl of spicy noodles for only $5.95.  Add a bowl of Szechuan Hot Oil Wontons (comes with 10 mini wontons) for $4.95.
